body:
The correct thing to do I think is remove all references. It's non-C89
without a portable alternative.

On Sun, May 24, 2015, 12:39 PM Aleksey Filippov notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Compilation fails under GCC 5.1.0
> 
> src/core/httpcli/httpcli.c:71:28: error: ISO C does not support '
> _FUNCTION_' predefined identifier [-Werror=pedantic]
> 
> Can be fixed with
> $ find . -type f -exec sed -r 's|_FUNCTION_|_func_|g' -i '{}' ';'
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1739.

Also, TIL **FUNCTION** is non-standard.

On Sun, May 24, 2015, 1:27 PM Craig Tiller ctiller@google.com wrote:

> The correct thing to do I think is remove all references. It's non-C89
> without a portable alternative.
> 
> On Sun, May 24, 2015, 12:39 PM Aleksey Filippov notifications@github.com
> wrote:
> 
> > Compilation fails under GCC 5.1.0
> > 
> > src/core/httpcli/httpcli.c:71:28: error: ISO C does not support '
> > _FUNCTION_' predefined identifier [-Werror=pedantic]
> > 
> > Can be fixed with
> > $ find . -type f -exec sed -r 's|_FUNCTION_|_func_|g' -i '{}' ';'
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1739.

Actually, lets just introduce GPR_FUNCTION_NAME in port_platform.h?

On Sun, May 24, 2015, 1:27 PM Craig Tiller ctiller@google.com wrote:

> Also, TIL **FUNCTION** is non-standard.
> 
> On Sun, May 24, 2015, 1:27 PM Craig Tiller ctiller@google.com wrote:
> 
> > The correct thing to do I think is remove all references. It's non-C89
> > without a portable alternative.
> > 
> > On Sun, May 24, 2015, 12:39 PM Aleksey Filippov notifications@github.com
> > wrote:
> > 
> > > Compilation fails under GCC 5.1.0
> > >

> > > _FUNCTION_' predefined identifier [-Werror=pedantic]
> > > 
> > > Can be fixed with

> > > 
> > > —
